content: Really a shame about Paul Harvey passing away. He was Ninty years old and I remember him from somewhere back in the sixties. He was fair, non prejudiced and non bigoted and had a kind word for almost everyone (except stupid politicians). He read the news in his own manner and could tell a story like noone else. His "rest of the story" keep your attention until the finish and then surprised you with who the story was about. I looked up to Paul Harvey for being a roll model to American youth. Lead on Paul. You will be missed!

content: quote: Harvey concluded: We didn't come this far because we're made of sugar candy. Once upon a time, we elbowed our way onto and across this continent by giving smallpox-infected blankets to Native Americans. That was biological warfare. And we used every other weapon we could get our hands on to grab this land from whomever. And we grew prosperous. And yes, we greased the skids with the sweat of slaves. So it goes with most great nation-states, which--feeling guilty about their savage pasts--eventually civilize themselves out of business and wind up invaded and ultimately dominated by the lean, hungry up-and-coming who are not made of sugar candy. *http://www.fair.org/index.php?page=2569]http://www.fair.org/index.php?page=2569 And gets a freedom award from Bush.... So, what's wrong with telling the truth? Ain't a single empire in recorded history that hasn't followed that model. What makes you think America is sacrosanct. If you believe in God and "manifest destiny", he hit the nail square on the head. If you believe in science and evolution, which makes no room for anything but Machiavellian situational ethics and amorality, he still hit the nail square on the head. And if you don't believe in anything, then he STILL hit the nail square on the head.... Now, if all you agree with is sounding politically correct, being namby pamby, and not saying anything that will hurt someone's feelings, then you fit into this paragraph describing the current trend of knee-jerk liberal no spine America: "eventually civilize themselves out of business and wind up invaded and ultimately dominated by the lean, hungry up-and-coming who are not made of sugar candy." .....and could possibly be around to see it come true, as our economy and society collapses. But even in that case, he STILL hit the nail right on the head - - And THAT may be the REST of the story! Wandering and Wondering

content: As Teddy Roosevelt once said, "The people of the World will never love us. They may respect us. They may even grow to fear us. But they will never love us, for we have too much Audacity!" He also wanted the Grizzly Bear to be the symbol of our Nation, because it always wondered its territory alone, respected and feared by all it met - but always alone - - As for the Eagle? He considered it a "Dandified Vulture!". . . We could use a "Trust Busting, Azz Kicking Teddy," Right Now!! Note the Globe is positioned to show North America, from Panama to the North Pole. If Teddy had stayed in office, instead of turning over the country to Taft, that would probably be the United States of America today - - What a pity - Wandering and Wondering
